qas.question: At what street address is the Lord Mayor's residence located?
Who gave the Lord Mayor's official residence to Plymouth?
On what street is the Civic Centre office building located?
In what month and year did the Civic Centre municipal office building become a listed building?
What did Plymouth council estimate the cost to refurbish the Civic Centre municipal office building to be?

context: The Lord Mayor's official residence is <a0_0>3 Elliot Terrace<a0_0/>, located on the Hoe. Once a home of Waldorf and Nancy Astor, it was given by <a1_0>Lady Astor<a1_0/> to the City of Plymouth as an official residence for future Lord Mayors and is also used today for civic hospitality, as lodgings for visiting dignitaries and High Court judges and it is also available to hire for private events. The Civic Centre municipal office building in <a2_0>Armada Way<a2_0/> became a listed building in <a3_0>June 2007<a3_0/> because of its quality and period features, but has become the centre of a controversy as the council planned for its demolition estimating that it could cost <a4_0>£40m<a4_0/> to refurbish it, resulting in possible job losses.
